DataElement.preferredName: Developmental Neuropsychological Assessment (NEPSY) Outcome Scale Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the total score on the Development Neuropsychological Assessment (NEPSY), a series of neurocognitive tests for children from 3 to 16 years of age.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A brief quantitative test used for assessing cognitive function in adults._A series of neurocognitive tests for children from 3 to 16 years of age.  NEPSY can be used for general, diagnostic, selective, or full assessment of neuropsychological development. (Copyright: Pearson Education, Inc.; Marit Korkman, Ph.D., Ursula Kirk, Ph.D., and Sally Kemp, Ph.D., authors)_Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A series of neurocognitive tests for children from 3 to 16 years of age. (Copyright: Pearson Education, Inc.; Marit Korkman, Ph.D., Ursula Kirk, Ph.D., and Sally Kemp, Ph.D., authors)
